lines.text: I'm the baby; gotta love me!

[hitting Earl with a bottle]
Not the mama, not the mama, not the mama.
I really wish you'd grow out of this.
[Said at the beginning of each episode]
Maybe I've learned something today. Good parenting does come from here
but when you need a little help, you can find it here
Gee, now there's something you don't see on TV.
Good morning, my family who loves me.

All right, that ends right now. I've had it up to here with this "not the mama". I am not "not the nama", I'm your daddy, and you only get one, buster, and that's what you're gonna call me. Daddy. Now say "Daddy".
Okay, all right, all right. Say "da".
He loves me, listen to him!
Daddy, Da-Daddy, Da-Daddy, Daddy, Daddy. NOT THE MAMA!
She's too controlling, I wanna wear a dress!
How much can a tutor cost, Earl?
The same amount as a 90 inch TV screen, because that's the way my life works.

Sinclair, you dog. Twenty-five years you've been working here and I never thought you'd have the guts to take me on! But take me on, you do, mano e mano, man to man. That's guts-balls, Sinclair. I like a guy with guts-balls. LIKE HIM!
So I guess I'm gonna have to take your little ultimatum seriously.
Oh I do hope so, sir.
Cuz the someone who puts a gun to my head...
...MUST BE PREPARED TO BACK UP HIS THREAT! So I'm gonna ask you, d'ya want a raise or what?
What puts you in the position to ask for more money?
Well sir, I have a growing family, who I need more money to take care of.
Well, Where is this my fault?
THEN WHY DO I HAVE TO PAY FOR YOUR FAMILY!
I'm only asking for more money, sir.
No, the way I see it is, you don't need more money, you need less family!
Well obviously you do, since you're willing to lose your job for them.
You face me down, asking me for more money. I ain't gonna give it to ya. So ya got no alternative but to look me in the eye and say...
Oh, sorry to lose ya, Sinclair, after all these years.
But sir I like this company. I always dreamed I'd go somewhere with this company.
No dreams, Sinclair. No dreams for you. You are what you are and that's all you're ever gonna be. Except not with this company. Best thing for you to do is realize that now. You'll thank me.

[Fran is giving Earl the silent treatment because he mistakenly buried her mother alive; Earl reads from the apology card he bought]
What can I say? I've ruined your day, and made you all angry and surly. How could I make such a thoughtless mistake? And bury your mother too early.

[Fran continues to ignore him]
Aw come on, Fran! They wouldn't make these cards if it didn't happen all the time!
